hanzi-su-wiki:
四

Значения

Четыре

Мнемоника


Иероглиф напоминает квадратное (4-угольное) окно с занавесками.

Произношение и тон

sì
📢 За окном было сыро.
♫ Сыро — плохая погода (нисходящий 4-й тон).

Варианты

亖, 肆

purpleculture_examples:
四川 [ sì chuān ]: Sichuan province (Szechuan) in southwest China, abbr. 川 or 蜀 , capital Chengdu 成都
四周 [ sì zhōu ]: all around
四处 [ sì chù ]: all over the place; everywhere and all directions
四人帮 [ sì rén bāng ]: Gang of Four: Jiang Qing 江青 , Zhang Chunqiao 張春橋 , Yao Wenyuan 姚文元 , Wang Hongwen 王洪文 , who served as scapegoats for the excesses of the cultural revolution
四面 [ sì miàn ]: all sides

heisig_chinese_memo: FOUR year-olds often put their FOOT (human legs) in their MOUTH but they are too young to realize it.
heisig_story: This character is composed of two primitive elements, mouth and human legs, both of which we will meet in the coming lessons. Assuming that you already knew how to write this kanji, we will pass over the "story" connected with it until later. Note how the second stroke is written left-to-right and then top-to-bottom. This is consistent with what we have already seen in the first three numbers and leads us to a general principle that will be helpful when we come to more complicated kanji later on: write north-to-south, west-to-east, northwest-to-southeast.
koohiiStory1: FOUR year-olds often put their FOOT (human legs) in their MOUTH - but they are too young to realize.
koohiiStory2: I imagine a giant devouring a human in four bites. First the giant bites off the person´s head, then he bites the torso, then from the waist to the knees, and finally the giant plucks up the remaining portion of the human legs into his mouth. See the fourth bite falling in there?

四角(しかく): square
四角い(しかくい): square
四季(しき): four seasons
四捨五入(ししゃごにゅう): rounding up (especially fractions)
四つ角(よつかど): four corners, crossroads
四(よん): four, fourth, quadruple
四(し): four
四日(よっか): fourth day of the month, four days
四つ(よっつ): four
jp_readingExamples: 四 (よ), 四つ (よ.つ), 四つ (よっ.つ), 四 (よん)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Imagine contorting yourself in such a way that your legs end up inside your mouth. You have bent your body in all the wrong ways in order to achieve this. In fact, if you look at yourself, you look like a square now... You're just a person with four sides.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: If you can get to square, you should be able to get to four as well, since squares always have four sides.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: This amazing feat, which turned you into a four sided square, has you looking like a four sided animal: the sheep (し). Look at yourself in the mirror and see an adorable four-sided sheep looking back at you. (You can't see the other sides because mirrors aren't 3D and whatnot. So you're a bit cartoonish.)
WaniKani_Reading_Info: What's better than one four sided sheep?
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the legs (儿) are in the box (囗) - four of them!
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: FOUR year-olds often put their FOOT (human legs) in their MOUTH but they are too young to realize it.
origin_of_ch_char_book: Before the invention of Hanzi (Chinese characters), the Chinese used knots (rope) or simple symbols. As the society became more complex, the need for more efficient ways for communication were needed. Hanzi (Chinese characters) were developed to meet such needs. What did the early writers think to express number “one”? As children use their fingers to count, the ancient people used twigs and sticks to express numbers and to count. A twig (一, yi, one), two twigs (二, er, two), three twings (三, san, three) four twigs (四, si=ssu, four) became the letters from 1 to 4. Branches used for telling fortunes or for calculation (14th-19th century) However, “one” 一 (yi, one) does not simply mean the number one in the numerical sense. In AD 100, a Chinese scholar wrote a book “Shuo Wen Jie Zi” which provides many explanations behind Hanzi. Among over 9,000 Hanzi characters in this book, the “one (一)” is explained first as followed: “In the beginning there was only One Way, and this Way divided earth from heaven and made everything.” As we can see, “one” is not just a simple tree twig. It is also philosophically understood as the “sole principle” from which heaven, earth and living things originate d from.
humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle draws from the four horizontal planes, like the horizontal position (Xu Zhongshu), the accumulation of four sections is the number, the original meaning is four.

The inscriptions on the oracle bones were inherited in the early inscriptions, and after the Spring and Autumn Period, there was a form of writing " four ", which was similar to the ancient inscriptions of Shuo Wen. Scholars believe that the " four " form is the original word for "呬", which resembles the breath exhaled from the mouth and nose. "Dialect": "Hey, breathe out." "Shuowen": "Dongyi says that breathe out is mournful" (Ding Shan, Zeng Xiantong). Because the sound is the same, " four " is used as the number four, so the word "呬" is added beside the mouth to express the original meaning of four.

Jia Jinwen is used as a numeral to indicate four. Wu Kesi: "Wang Yi (given) without horses (four) horses".

"Said Wen": "Four, Yin number also. Like the shape of a quarter. All four belongings are from four. 𦉭, ancient text four. I, Yiwen four."
humanum_short_description_en: Oracle draws from the four horizontal lines, like the horizontal position of the bar (Xu Zhongshu), the accumulation of four points is a number, the original meaning is four.
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文從四橫劃，象橫置之算籌形(徐中舒)，積四劃為數，本義是四。

　　早期金文承甲骨文字形，春秋以後有寫作「四」之形，與《說文》古文形近。學者認為「四」形乃「呬」之本字，象口、鼻呼出之氣息形。《方言》：「呬，息也。」《說文》：「東夷謂息為呬」(丁山、曾憲通)。因為音同，假借「四」為數字四，故增口旁造「呬」字以表示四之本義。

　　甲金文用作數詞，表示四。無㠱簋：「王易(賜)無㠱馬亖(四)匹」。

　　《說文》：「四，陰數也。象四分之形。凡四之屬皆从四。𦉭，古文四。亖，籒文四。」
humanum_short_description: 甲骨文從四橫劃，象橫置之算籌形(徐中舒)，積四劃為數，本義是四。

甲骨文從四橫劃，象橫置之算籌形(徐中舒)，積四劃為數，本義是四。 早期金文承甲骨文字形，春秋以後有寫作「 四 」之形，與《說文》古文形近。學者認為「 四 」形乃「 呬 」之本字，象口、鼻呼出之氣息形。《方言》：「呬，息也。」《說文》：「東夷謂息為呬」(丁山、曾憲通)。因為音同，假借「 四 」為數字四，故增口旁造「 呬 」字以表示四之本義。 甲金文用作數詞，表示四。無㠱簋：「王易(賜)無㠱馬亖(四)匹」。 《說文》：「四，陰數也。象四分之形。凡四之屬皆从四。𦉭，古文四。亖，籒文四。」
Oracle draws from the four horizontal planes, like the horizontal position (Xu Zhongshu), the accumulation of four sections is the number, the original meaning is four. The inscriptions on the oracle bones were inherited in the early inscriptions, and after the Spring and Autumn Period, there was a form of writing " four", which was similar to the ancient inscriptions of Shuo Wen. Scholars believe that the " four" form is the original word for " 呬", which resembles the breath exhaled from the mouth and nose. "Dialect": "Hey, breathe out." "Shuowen": "Dongyi says that breathe out is mournful" (Ding Shan, Zeng Xiantong). Because the sound is the same, " four" is used as the number four, so the word " 呬" is added beside the mouth to express the original meaning of four. Jia Jinwen is used as a numeral to indicate four. Wu Kesi: "Wang Yi (given) without horses (four) horses". "Said Wen": "Four, Yin number also. Like the shape of a quarter. All four belongings are from four. 𦉭, ancient text four. I, Yiwen four."

四字的基本解释

四
sì
数名，三加一（在钞票和单据上常用大写“肆”代）：四方。四边。四序（即“四季”）。四体（ａ．指人的四肢；ｂ．指楷、草、隶、篆四种字体）。四库（古籍经、史、子、集四部的代称。亦称“四部”）。四君子（中国画中对梅、兰、竹、菊四种花卉题材的总称）。
中国古代乐谱的记音符号，相当于简谱“6”。

四字的汉语字典释义

[①]［sì］
［《廣韻》息利切，去至，心。］
“亖1”的今字。
(1)数词。三加一所得。
(2)表示序数第四。
(3)工尺谱记音符号之一，表示音阶上的一级。
(4)通“駟”。参见“四從”。
(5)姓。春秋越有四水。见汉刘向《说苑·权谋》。

四字的英文翻译

◎ 四
four

四字的康熙字典解释

【丑集上】【囗字部】　四； 康熙笔画：5； 页码：页216第22
〔古文〕?【唐韻】【集韻】?息利切，音泗。【說文】囗，四方也。八，別也。囗中八，象四分之形。　又【玉篇】隂數次三也。【正韻】倍二爲四。【易·繫辭】天一地二，天三地四，天五地六，天七地八，天九地十，五位相得而各有合。【又】兩儀生四象，四象生八卦。　又姓。【正字通】宋有四象，慶元閒知汀州府。　又【正字通】今官司文移變四作肆，防詐譌?易，非四之本義也。　又【集韻】息七切，音悉。關中謂四數爲悉。○按《正字通》云平聲音司，引《樂譜》四五讀司烏，不知此特口變易，非四有司音也。《正字通》誤。

四字的源字形

四字的起名意思

：指数量，如四山五岳；指抱负和理想，如志在四方。

four
Basic explanation of words
four
sì
Several names, three plus one (usually capitalized "4" on banknotes and receipts): Quartet. four sides. Four Sequences (ie "Four Seasons"). Four-body (a. refers to human limbs; b. refers to four fonts: Kai, Cao, Li, and seal). Siku (a representative name for the four parts of ancient books, Scripture, History, Zi, and Ji. Also known as "four parts"). The Four Gentlemen (the general term for the four flower subjects of plum, orchid, bamboo and chrysanthemum in Chinese painting).
The notation of Chinese ancient music score is equivalent to "6" in numbered musical notation.
four
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［sì］
["Guangyun" Xiliqi, go to, heart. ]
The present character of "亖1".
(1) Numerals. Three plus one income.
(2) Represents the fourth ordinal number.
(3) One of the notation symbols of Gongchi notation, which represents the upper level of the musical scale.
(4) Through "Si". See "Four Followers".
(5) Last name. There are four waters in the spring and autumn. See Han Liu Xiang's "Suo Yuan·Strategy".
four

four
four

The middle eight is like a quarter shape.　[Jade articles] Yin several times and three also. [Zheng Yun] Two times as four. 【Essence of Yi·Ci】The sky is one and the earth is two, the sky is three and the earth is four, the sky is five and the earth is six, the sky is seven and the earth is eight, and the sky is nine and the earth is ten. [Also] The two elements give birth to the four elephants, and the four images give rise to gossip.　Another last name. It is not the original meaning of four.　 [Ji Yun] Qi Qi cuts the interest, the sound is clear. l三
четыре
четыре
четыре
«Четыре» символа в надписях на костях оракула и бронзовых надписях обычно написаны в виде четырех горизонтальных рисунков.
Позже иероглиф «четыре», означающий «дыхание», был заимствован (это значение записывается как «?» После того, как символ «четыре» записывался долгое время, не возвращая его, современный звук xi) в качестве числового символа «четыре». ".

四

sì Четыре

四

Значения

Четыре

Мнемоника


Иероглиф напоминает квадратное (4-угольное) окно с занавесками.

Произношение и тон

sì
📢 За окном было сыро.
♫ Сыро — плохая погода (нисходящий 4-й тон).

Варианты

亖, 肆

Radicals: 口, 儿  (mouth, legs)
Meaning Mnemonic
Imagine contorting yourself in such a way that your legs end up inside your mouth. You have bent your body in all the wrong ways in order to achieve this. In fact, if you look at yourself, you look like a square now... You're just a person with four sides.
If you can get to square, you should be able to get to four as well, since squares always have four sides.
Reading Mnemonic
This amazing feat, which turned you into a four sided square, has you looking like a four sided animal: the sheep (し). Look at yourself in the mirror and see an adorable four-sided sheep looking back at you. (You can't see the other sides because mirrors aren't 3D and whatnot. So you're a bit cartoonish.)
What's better than one four sided sheep?
